abstracts.cdata!:
A landlocked country mostly desert and
            subject to drought, Mali must manage water resources in ways
            that provide the maximum benefit to its growing population.
            The Niger River and the rich green plains it flows through
            are critical to the entire nation's economy and to the
            population's supply of food. However, the agency mainly
            responsible for irrigation managementthe Office du
            Nigerdates back to the colonial era, and functioned in ways
            that added to the farmer's costs and lowered production
            of rice and other basic food staples.
